subsection.title: Bessel Functions, Hankel Functions, and Modified Bessel Functions as Airy Functions

para.sentence: Again, for the notation see §§10.2(ii) and 10.25(ii).

With z=(\tfrac{3}{2}\zeta)^{2/3}, J_{\pm 1/3}\left(\zeta\right)=\tfrac{1}{2}\sqrt{3/z}\left(\sqrt{3}\mathrm{Ai} \left(-z\right)\mp\mathrm{Bi}\left(-z\right)\right), , J_{\pm 2/3}\left(\zeta\right)=\tfrac{1}{2}(\sqrt{3}/z)\left(\pm\sqrt{3}\mathrm {Ai}'\left(-z\right)+\mathrm{Bi}'\left(-z\right)\right), I_{\pm 1/3}\left(\zeta\right)=\tfrac{1}{2}\sqrt{3/z}\left(\mp\sqrt{3}\mathrm{ Ai}\left(z\right)+\mathrm{Bi}\left(z\right)\right), , I_{\pm 2/3}\left(\zeta\right)=\tfrac{1}{2}(\sqrt{3}/z)\left(\pm\sqrt{3}\mathrm {Ai}'\left(z\right)+\mathrm{Bi}'\left(z\right)\right), K_{\pm 1/3}\left(\zeta\right)=\pi\sqrt{3/z}\mathrm{Ai}\left(z\right), , K_{\pm 2/3}\left(\zeta\right)=-\pi(\sqrt{3}/z)\mathrm{Ai}'\left(z\right), {H^{(1)}_{1/3}}\left(\zeta\right)=e^{-\pi i/3}{H^{(1)}_{-1/3}}\left(\zeta \right)=e^{-\pi i/6}\sqrt{3/z}\left(\mathrm{Ai}\left(-z\right)-i\mathrm{Bi} \left(-z\right)\right), , {H^{(1)}_{2/3}}\left(\zeta\right)=e^{-2\pi i/3}{H^{(1)}_{-2/3}}\left(\zeta \right)=e^{\pi i/6}(\sqrt{3}/z)\left(\mathrm{Ai}'\left(-z\right)-i\mathrm{Bi}' \left(-z\right)\right), {H^{(2)}_{1/3}}\left(\zeta\right)=e^{\pi i/3}{H^{(2)}_{-1/3}}\left(\zeta\right )=e^{\pi i/6}\sqrt{3/z}\left(\mathrm{Ai}\left(-z\right)+i\mathrm{Bi}\left(-z \right)\right), , {H^{(2)}_{2/3}}\left(\zeta\right)=e^{2\pi i/3}{H^{(2)}_{-2/3}}\left(\zeta \right)=e^{-\pi i/6}(\sqrt{3}/z)\left(\mathrm{Ai}'\left(-z\right)+i\mathrm{Bi} '\left(-z\right)\right).

subsection.title: Airy Functions as Confluent Hypergeometric Functions

para.sentence: To express Airy functions in terms of hypergeometric functions combine §9.6(i) with (10.39.9).
